bountyExplanation: A bounty is a call for help: a student posts a question or problem they need support with. By posting a bounty, someone asks the community to think along or help directly. This can be study questions, technical challenges, practical matters, or other topics where you need quick help. Do you have the answer or can you help? Respond to this bounty and make a difference together!

createEvent.errorRequired: Please fill in all required fields (title, date, company).

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: How do I make a good study plan?
faq.a1: Use a planner or digital calendar, set priorities, and break large tasks into smaller steps.
faq.q2: What can I do against procrastination?
faq.a2: Set clear goals, work in blocks, and reward yourself after completing tasks.
faq.q3: How do I find study buddies?
faq.a3: Join study groups, attend introduction activities, or use the chat function in the StudentHub app.
faq.a4: Ask fellow students, check your program's intranet, or share your own summaries in the app.
faq.q5: How do I prepare for exams?
faq.a5: Start early, do practice exercises, and discuss difficult topics with others.
faq.q6: What if I lose my motivation?
faq.a6: Think about your goals, talk to fellow students or a study coach, and try to add variety to your day.
faq.q7: How do I combine work and study?
faq.a7: Make a realistic schedule, communicate with your employer, and get enough rest.
faq.q8: Where can I get help with stress?
faq.a8: Talk to a study counselor, use mindfulness exercises, or contact a confidant.
faq.q9: How can I improve my presentation skills?
faq.a9: Practice your presentation out loud, ask for feedback, and use clear slides.
faq.q10: What should I do if I miss a deadline?
faq.a10: Contact your teacher immediately and explain your situation. Sometimes an extension is possible.
faq.q11: How do I find an internship?
faq.a11: Use your program's network, search job sites, and ask fellow students for tips.
faq.q12: What are useful apps for students?
faq.a12: StudentHub, Google Calendar, Notion, Microsoft OneNote, and Slack are popular among students.
faq.q13: How do I stay motivated during online classes?
faq.a13: Keep a routine, take notes, and actively participate in class.
faq.q14: How can I collaborate effectively on group assignments?
faq.a14: Make clear agreements, divide tasks, and keep in regular contact via chat or video.
faq.q15: What if I struggle with a particular subject?
faq.a15: Ask your teacher for help, find a tutor, or form a study group.
faq.q16: How do I keep balance between study and private life?
faq.a16: Schedule free time, keep exercising, and get enough sleep.
faq.q17: Where can I go with personal problems?
faq.a17: Contact the student psychologist or confidant at your program.
faq.q18: How can I improve my concentration?
faq.a18: Work in short blocks, put your phone away, and keep your study area tidy.
faq.q19: What are good ways to network?
faq.a19: Attend events, join study associations, and be active on LinkedIn.
faq.q20: How can I deal with performance anxiety?
faq.a20: Talk about it with others, prepare well, and try relaxation exercises.
faq.q21: How do I apply for student finance?
faq.a21: Go to the DUO website and follow the steps to apply for student finance.
faq.q22: What should I do if I'm sick during an exam?
faq.a22: Report your illness to your program immediately and ask about resit options.
faq.q23: How can I view my study results?
faq.a23: Log in to your program's student portal to view your grades.
faq.q24: What are tips for writing a thesis?
faq.a24: Start early, make a clear structure, and ask for feedback regularly.
faq.q25: How do I find cheap textbooks?
faq.a25: Check second-hand websites, ask senior students, or use digital versions.
faq.q26: What if I lose my public transport card?
faq.a26: Report it immediately to OV-chipkaart customer service and request a replacement card.
faq.q27: How can I improve my English?
faq.a27: Watch English movies, read books, and practice with fellow students or via apps.
faq.q28: How do I make a good CV?
faq.a28: Use a clear format, mention relevant experience, and keep it organized.
faq.a29: Make summaries, ask questions, and alternate studying with breaks.
faq.q30: How can I deal with study stress?
faq.a30: Talk about it, get enough rest, and relax with hobbies or sports.
faq.q31: How can I manage my time better?
faq.a31: Use a planner, set priorities, and be realistic about what you can do.
faq.q32: What should I do if I want to quit my studies?
faq.a32: Consult a study advisor and deregister from your program and DUO in time.
faq.q33: How can I find a side job next to my studies?
faq.a33: Check job sites, ask friends, or look at your program's notice board.
faq.q34: What are the benefits of joining a study association?
faq.a34: You meet new people, gain experience, and get access to fun activities.
faq.q35: How can I improve my presentation skills?
faq.a35: Practice a lot, ask for feedback, and watch good examples on YouTube.
faq.q36: What should I do if I get a failing grade?
faq.a36: See where things went wrong, ask for feedback, and prepare well for the resit.
faq.q37: How can I keep track of my study credits?
faq.a37: Use the student portal or keep your own overview in Excel or an app.
faq.q38: How do I easily contact teachers?
faq.a38: Send a clear email or talk to them after class.
faq.q39: What are good ways to relax after studying?
faq.a39: Exercise, watch a movie, meet friends, or go for a walk.
faq.q40: How can I deal with peer pressure?
faq.a40: Stay true to yourself, set your boundaries, and talk to someone you trust.
